meaningMnemonic: Under your <radical>roof</radical> in <radical>winter</radical> there are more <radical>mouth</radical>s to feed because you let <kanji>guest</kanji>s stay with you when it's cold. Some of them aren't family, so they have to pay to stay under your roof and get food. Those are <kanji>customer</kanji>s.
readingMnemonic: One of your <kanji>guest</kanji>s is a regular named <reading>Kyaku</reading> (きゃく) the <kanji>customer</kanji>. Kyaku is always staying over at one place or another, so everyone knows their name.
